news_header: Companies in the UK are planning to cut jobs or hire fewer workers due to rising National Insurance payments and wages, according to a survey. Many businesses intend to raise prices to cover increased employment costs.
news_original_title: Firms plan job cuts as employment costs rise
news_text: Confidence among small firms has dropped to its lowest in a decade, excluding the pandemic. The government has announced increases in National Insurance Contributions and the National Minimum Wage, effective in April, which may lead to further job losses and reduced investment. The Bank of England warns that inflation may spike later this year, although it is gradually slowing down.
